intro: Bouvardia heterophylla, commonly known as the variable bouvardia, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink and red. The plant typically grows as an erect shrub with lance-shaped leaves that are often hairy. It produces showy, fragrant blooms that are popular in floral arrangements due to their longevity and aesthetic appeal. Bouvardia heterophylla thrives in well-drained soil and prefers bright, indirect light.
